text: Barbara Piévic (born 10 April, 1993) better known as Barbara Pravi, is a French-Serbian-Iranian singer and writer. She represented France at Eurovision Song Contest 2021 with "Voilà" and was the runner-up. Pravi has also written numerous songs for multiple artists including Yannick Noah, Julie Zenatti, Chimène Badi, and Jaden Smith. She also composed the songs "J'imagine" (which won the Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2020) and "Oh maman!" (which won the Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2022). In February 2023, she released a book named Lève-toi. == Background == She was born in Paris. Pravi's father is from Serbia and is of Algerian descent. Her mother is of Polish and Iranian origin. Pravi's maternal grandfather is painter Hossein Zenderoudi. == Sources == Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:Singers from Paris Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants
title: Barbara Pravi
